Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure outspread wing of bird or siren with added white dots and alternating added red and white wing feathers.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the decoration of the wings, see Alexandria 17251 and British Museum 1952,0505.8.a-b from Tell Dafana.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.124) (phase 3)
